quiz.text: The National Financial Reporting Authority (NFRA) Chairperson recently participated in the inaugural session of a conference organized by which organization?
options: United Nations
World Health Organization
ASSOCHAM
International Monetary Fund
World Trade Organization

quiz.text: The National Financial Reporting Authority (NFRA) was established under the Companies Act, 2013, to protect public interest in financial reporting. Which of the following statements about NFRA's role is true?
options: NFRA's primary role is to facilitate international trade agreements.
NFRA focuses on promoting cultural exchanges in the financial sector.
NFRA ensures high-quality standards in the pharmaceutical industry.
NFRA is responsible for overseeing the transportation sector.
NFRA establishes high quality standards of accounting and auditing, and exercises effective oversight of accounting and auditing functions performed by companies and auditors.

quiz.text: During the 8th India-Australia Defence Policy Talks, what key aspect did the Indian side emphasize regarding cooperation with the Australian Armed forces?1. Both countries discussed measures to enhance the 2020’s Comprehensive Strategic Partnership.2. The talks aimed to address environmental challenges in the Asia-Pacific region.3. The Indian side highlighted the potential to cooperate with the Australian Armed forces in its shipbuilding and maintenance plans.
options: 1 and 2
2 and 3
1 and 3
All of the above
None of the above

quiz.text: Recently, the United Kingdom (UK) and India concluded the eleventh round of talks for the UK-India Free Trade Agreement (FTA) at the UK. What is the main objective of the UK-India Free Trade Agreement (FTA)?
options: To establish a joint space exploration mission.
To address climate change challenges in the Asia-Pacific region.
To facilitate the target of doubling bilateral trade between India and the United Kingdom by 2030.
To promote cultural exchanges between the two countries.
To negotiate nuclear energy projects.

quiz.text: Union Minister of Commerce and Industry recently addressed as a Chief Guest at India International Footwear Fair 2023 (IIFF) at New Delhi and shared the data regarding the Indian Footwear & Leather industry in India. Among the following options, which statement about the Indian Footwear & Leather industry is incorrect?
options: The industry is labor-intensive and employs around 4.5 million people, with 40% being women.
The Indian Footwear & Leather industry contributed significantly to the country's export earnings, reaching around US $3.68 billion during 2020-21.
India is the 2nd largest exporter of leather garments in the world.
India is the 3rd largest exporter of Saddlery & Harness in the world.
More than 50% of the production units in this sector are Ministry of Micro, Small & Medium Enterprises (MSME) units.

quiz.text: As of July 2023, what percentage of Indian enterprises are classified as MSMEs, according to the Udyam Registration Portal?
options: 50%
65%
75%
99.3%
100%

quiz.text: Which of the following initiatives supports Micro and Small Enterprises under the Procurement and Marketing Support Scheme?
options: Financial assistance for setting up manufacturing units.
Financial assistance to Micro units for Bar Code Adoption: Up to 80% of the registration fee for obtaining up to 1000 bar codes subject to a maximum of ₹50,650.
Direct subsidy for exporting products overseas.
Loan waiver for Small Enterprises facing financial challenges.
Tax incentives for Medium-sized enterprises investing in research and development.

quiz.text: Which of the following statements is incorrect regarding the amendments done in 2021 to the Flag Code of India, 2002?
options: The amended Flag Code allows the manufacturing of the National Flag of India using polyester material.
Before the amendment, the National Flag was exclusively made from khadi or silk.
The amended Flag Code restricts the National Flag's composition to hand spun and hand-woven khadi only.
Total 4 Khadi Institutions hold the BIS license to manufacture the Indian Standard-I (IS-I) National Flag.
Madhya Bharat Khadi Sangh in Madhya Pradesh is one of the institutions allowed to produce the IS-I National Flag.

quiz.text: What is the main target of the National Coal Gasification Mission launched by the Coal Ministry? 1. The target is to achieve coal gasification and liquefaction of 100 million tons of coal by 2030. 2. Coal India Limited (CIL) has signed MOUs with BHEL, GAIL and IOCL to take up coal gasification projects. 3. A provision has been made for 50% rebate in revenue share for all future commercial coal block auctions for the coal used in gasification purpose.
options: 1 and 2
2 and 3
1 and 3
All of the above
None of the above

quiz.text: In India's current energy basket, the share of natural gas is 6.7%. What is the target set by the Government to raise this share in the energy mix by 2030?
options: 10%
12.5%
15%
18%
20%

quiz.text: Under the Ship Building Financial Assistance Policy (2016-2026), what percentage of financial assistance is provided to Indian shipyards based on the contract price, actual receipts, or fair price (whichever is least)?
options: 10%
20%
25%
28%
30%

quiz.text: The "MSME Samadhan Portal" is primarily designed to address and resolve which of the following challenges faced by MSMEs?
options: Access to finance and loans.
Skill development and training programs.
Regulatory compliance and tax filing.
Market expansion and export facilitation.
Disputes related to delayed payments from buyers.

quiz.text: At the inter-Ministerial meeting assessing the National Logistics Policy, what does the "Logistics Ease across Different States (LEADS)" initiative rate states on?
options: Ease of doing business only.
Infrastructure and services only.
Ease of logistics - infrastructure and services.
Logistics efficiency, economic factors, and overall performance.
Regulatory compliance and tax filing.

quiz.text: What is the targeted steel production capacity by 2030 under the National Steel Policy of 2017, and what percentage of this capacity is aimed to be contributed by the EAF/IF route?
options: 300 Million TPA, 35-40%
250 Million TPA, 25-30%
300 Million TPA, 40-45%
350 Million TPA, 35-40%
200 Million TPA, 50%

quiz.text: Recently (July 2023), Rashtriya Rail Sanraksha Kosh (RRSK) was mentioned in the Parliament. What is the total corpus allocated to the Rashtriya Rail Sanraksha Kosh (RRSK) for a span of five years?
options: Rs 50,000 crore
Rs 75,000 crore
Rs 1 lakh crore
Rs 1.5 lakh crore
Rs 2 lakh crore

quiz.text: According to the data for the year 2022-23, which of the following states rank(s) among the top states in terms of Per Capita Net State Domestic Product (PCNSDP) at current prices?1. Telangana.2. Assam3. Karnataka.4. Jammu & Kashmir5. Haryana
options: 1, 2, 3 and 4
1, 4 and 5
2, 3 and 5
1, 3 and 5
1, 2, 4 and 5

quiz.text: Which combination of sectors contributed significantly to the Overall Gross Value Added (GVA) at Current Prices for the year 2022-23?1. Financial, Real Estate & Professional Services.2. Agriculture, forestry and fishing.3. Trade, Hotels, Transport, and Communication & Services related to Broadcasting
options: 1 and 2
2 and 3
1 and 3
All of the above
None of the above

quiz.text: The virtual portal "Mera Gaon Meri Dharohar" was launched under which initiative by the Union Minister of State for Culture?
options: Digital India Campaign
National Mission on Cultural Mapping
Swachh Bharat Abhiyan
Make in India Initiative
Beti Bachao Beti Padhao Campaign

quiz.text: Which state in India recently became the first to ensure social security for gig workers by tabling the Platform Based GIG Workers (registration and welfare) Bill, 2023?
options: Maharashtra
Uttar Pradesh
Gujarat
Rajasthan
Tamil Nadu

quiz.text: Which international group has Algeria recently expressed its interest in joining?
options: G7
BRICS (Brazil, Russia, India, China & South Africa) group
ASEAN (Association of Southeast Asian Nations)
OPEC (Organization of the Petroleum Exporting Countries)
European Union

quiz.text: Recently (July 2023), Russia has terminated the implementation of Black Sea Grain Initiative. What was the primary objective of the Black Sea Grain Initiative signed in 2022 among Ukraine, Russia, Turkey, and the United Nations?
options: To establish a grain trade monopoly in the Black Sea region.
To promote cultural exchanges among the Black Sea countries.
To resume vital food and fertilizer exports from designated Ukrainian seaports.
To establish a military alliance among the signatory countries.
To increase tariffs on grain exports from Ukrainian seaports.

quiz.text: What distinguishes Bengaluru's recent inclusion in the World Cities Culture Forum (WCCF)?
options: It marks Bengaluru as the first city to host the annual World Cities Culture Summit.
Bengaluru becomes the first Indian city to be a member of the World Cities Culture Forum (WCCF).
Bengaluru has pledged the highest financial contribution to WCCF among all member cities.
Bengaluru has proposed a unique cultural exchange program with London, the founding city of WCCF.
Bengaluru's membership in WCCF signifies its commitment to becoming a cultural capital of Asia.

quiz.text: National Strategy and Roadmap for Medical and Wellness Tourism seen in news recently (July 2023), which of the following statement is incorrect with respect to medical tourism in India?
options: A new National Medical and Wellness Tourism Board to be created as Minister of Health and Family Welfare as its Chairman.
‘Incredible India’ brand-line is launched to promote various tourism destinations and products of the country.
e-medical Visa and e-Medical Attendant Visa are provided as the sub-categories of e-visa.
Under e-visa scheme triple entry is permitted and extension may be granted up to 6 months on case-to-case basis.
None of the above.

quiz.text: Which of the following statement is incorrect with respect to eSanjeevani initiative seen in the news recently (July 2023)?
options: It was launched in 2019 by the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare.
It is a national doctor to doctor telemedicine service that strives to provide an alternative to the conventional physical consultations via digital platform.
It is to be implemented under National Rural Health Mission (NRHM).
eSanjeevani is a cohesive part of Ayushman Bharat Digital Health Mission (ABDHM).
None of the above

quiz.text: As a part of Angdaan Mahotsav during the Organ Donation month of July, a National Webinar on Organ and Tissue Donation was organized by-
options: The National Organ and Tissue Transplant Organisation (NOTTO), in association with the Directorate General of Health Services
The National Organ and Tissue Transplant Organisation (NOTTO), in association with The Indian Council of Medical Research (ICMR)
The National Organ and Tissue Transplant Organisation (NOTTO), in association with the National Medical Commission (NMC)
The National Organ and Tissue Transplant Organisation (NOTTO), in association with the Indian Medical Association (IMA)
The National Organ and Tissue Transplant Organisation (NOTTO) only

quiz.text: National Tele-Mental Health Programme (NTMHP) seen in the news recently (July 2023). Which of the following statement is correct with respect to NTMHP?
options: It will include 23 tele-mental health centres of excellence; NIMHANS in Bengaluru to be nodal centre.
International Institute of Information technology (IIIT-Bangalore) providing technology support.
It was announced in Union Budget of 2022-2023.
In March 2020, the Telemedicine Practice Guidelines were released jointly by the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare and NITI Aayog.
All of the above.

quiz.text: National Policy for Rare Diseases (NPRD), 2021 has been seen in the news recently (July 2023). In this context, National Consortium for Research and Development on therapeutics for Rare Diseases has been convened by?
options: National Medical Commission (NMC)
Indian Medical Association (IMA)
National Registry for Rare and Other Inherited Disorders (NRROID)
Indian Council of Medical Research (ICMR)
Department of Health Research (DHR)

quiz.text: India's first Cannabis Medicine Project recently (July 2023) visited by the Union Minister of Science & Technology. It is located at the Cultivation Field of CSIR-IIIM in ______.
options: Punjab
Haryana
Jammu
Uttarakhand
Himachal Pradesh

quiz.text: Identify the correct statements with respect to key highlights of the recently (July 2023) convened Akhil Bharatiya Shiksha Samagam-A) Prime Minister (PM) of India inaugurated 3rd Akhil Bharatiya Shiksha Samagam, organized to mark the second anniversary of the National Education Policy (NEP) 2020.B) It was organized by the Ministry of Education and Ministry of Skill Development & Entrepreneurship.C) ULLAS (Understanding Lifelong Learning for All in Society) Mobile Application launched in the event Aims at bridging the gaps in basic literacy and critical life skills of citizens aged 15 and above.
options: Only A
Only A and C
Only C
Only B and C
All of the above

quiz.text: UGC has recently (July 2023) developed the "Guidelines on basic facilities and amenities in Higher Educational Institutions (HEIs)", these guidelines are related to-
options: Building Science and Experiment labs
Building Skill Centres
Libraries and reading rooms
Safety and security of women
None of the above

quiz.text: Harmonized System (ITC-HS) codes 38260000 seen in the news recently (July 2023), it is related to -
options: HS Classifications of man-made fibres
HS Classifications of food grains
HS Classifications of electronic items
HS Classifications of absorbent cotton products.
HS Classifications of Biodiesel and mixtures

quiz.text: It implies a sustainable development model with a focus on economic activities related to Ganga. PM Modi first introduced the concept during the first National Ganga Council meeting in Kanpur in 2019. It focuses upon the Monetization and Reuse of Sludge & Wastewater and Zero Budget Natural Farming. Above statements talk about the which of the following initiative?
options: Namami Gange
Arth Ganga
Urja Ganga
Karmayogi Ganga
None of the above

quiz.text: Recently (July 2023) official announcement of _______ came during the 14th Clean Energy Ministerial Meeting, with a formal launch planned at the G20 Leaders’ Summit in New Delhi in September this year. The alliance will be spearheaded by the United States, Brazil, and India.
options: International Solar Alliance
International E-mobility Alliance
Global Energy Alliance
International Renewable Energy Alliance
Global Bio-fuel Alliance

quiz.text: With respect to key highlights of the 14th Clean Energy Ministerial held recently (July 2023) identify the correct statement:    A) Alliance for Increasing Demand of Electric Freight Vehicles announced.    B) Initiative began with 16 companies voicing their support for 7,750 zero-emission trucks (ZETs).    D) e-FAST India (Electric Freight Accelerator for Sustainable Transport – India) is the    country's first platform to facilitate collaboration between government stakeholders and private sector partners.     D) NITI Aayog, in collaboration with World Resources Institute (WRI) India and World Economic Forum, launched an e- Freight Platform for enabling road-based electric freight(e-freight) transition.
options: A, B and C only
A and B only
B, C and D only
A and D only
All of the above.

quiz.text: While addressing the G20 Energy Ministerial meeting in Goa recently (July 2023), Prime Minister Narendra Modi announced to cover entire nation with E20 fuel by ________ from earlier planned in _______.
options: 2024, 2025
2025, 2030
2030, 2035
2035, 2040
2040, 2045

quiz.text: With respect to “Dialogue to forge path to 1.5°C aligned energy transition” which of the following statement is/are incorrect?      A) It was convened on the sidelines of the 14th Clean Energy Ministerial and G20 Energy Transitions Ministerial Meeting. B) It was organised by the COP28 Qatar Presidency and the International Energy Agency (IEA). C)  It underscored the necessity to triple annual renewable energy additions. D) The dialogue prepared the ground for specific commitments and calls-to-action at the World Climate Action Summit to be held at COP28.
options: A only
B only
C Only
D Only
None of the above

quiz.text: Environmental Compensation Funds (ECF) for Battery Waste Management seen in the news recently (July 2023). Identify the incorrect statement with respect to it-
options: The environmental compensation Fund is collected under Battery Waste Management Rules, 2020.
The funds collected under environmental compensation shall be utilised in the collection and refurbishing or recycling of uncollected and non-recycled waste batteries.

On the basis of ‘Polluter Pays Principle’, penalty imposed for non-fulfilment of Extended Producer Responsibility targets, responsibilities and obligations set out in the rules contributed to the ECF.
All of the above
None Of the above

quiz.text: NATIONAL AQUIFER MAPPING AND MANAGEMENT PROGRAMME(NAQUIM) has been in the news recently, identify correct statement with respect to it-A)     The National Aquifer Mapping and Management program (NAQUIM) is being implemented by the Central Ground Water Board (CGWB).B)      NAQUIM envisages mapping of aquifers, their characterization and development of Aquifer Management Plans to facilitate sustainable management of groundwater resources.C)      NAQUIM was initiated as a part of the Ground Water Management and Regulation Scheme.D)     Out of nearly 33 Lakh Sq. Km of geographical area of the country, the mappable area of around 25 Lakh Sq. Km was identified to be covered under NAQUIM.        E) The entire identified area has been covered by the CGWB before 31st March 2021.
options: A, B and C only
A, B, and D only
A, B, C, and D only
B, C, D and D only
All of the above

quiz.text: Jal Shakti Abhiyan: Catch the Rain 2023 has been seen in the news recently, identify correct statement with respect to it-A)      The aim is to nudge the states and all stakeholders to create Rain Water Harvesting Structures (RWHS), with people’s active participation. B)      Water being a State Subject, the responsibility primarily lies with the respective State Governments while Central Government provides financial assistance and technical guidance.C)      Timeline is 04 March 2023 to 30 November 2023 and the theme is “Source sustainability for drinking water”.D)      Ministry of Jal Shakti is taking up this nation-wide campaign since 2020.
options: A, B and C only
A, B, and D only
A, C, and D only
B, C, and D only
All of the above

quiz.text: Recently Union Minister of State for Labour and Employment informed the house about the registration figures of the unorganized workers using e-Shram portal. As of July 2023, number of workers registered on the portal are _______ which is about ________ of the unorganized workers in the country.
options: 28.96 crore, 75.49%
39.96 crore, 80.10%
18.96 crore, 72.49%
38.96 crore, 70.49%
48.96 crore, 65.49%

quiz.text: The union government recently (July 2023) approved the EPF interest rate of ______ for over 6 crore subscribers for the FY 2022-23.
options: 9.15%
8.5%
7.15%
8.15%
8.25%

quiz.text: The Lok Sabha recently cleared the Forest (Conservation) Amendment Bill,2023 which amended Forest (Conservation) Act, 1980. Identify correct statement with respect it-A)     The Act exempts all strategic linear projects of “national importance and concerning national security” within 200 km of international borders. B)      Exempt up to 10 ha of land proposed for security related infrastructure and up to 5 ha of forest land in Left Wing Extremism Affected Districts for public utility projects.C)      Promoting activities such as silvicultural operations, construction of zoos and wildlife safaris, eco-tourism facilities, and any other activities specified by the central government.D)     Exempts forest land along a rail line or a public road for providing access to a   habitation or to a rail, and roadside amenity up to a maximum size of 0.10 hectare.
options: A, B and C only
A, B and D only
B, C and C only
B and C only
All of the Above

quiz.text: Under Civil Liability for Nuclear Damage (CLND) Act 2010, India Nuclear Insurance Pool (INIP) was set up with General Insurance Corporation of India Limited (GIC-re), and several other ICs with a capacity of ______on 12th June, 2015.
options: 1500 Crore
2500 Crore
3500 Crore
4500 Crore
15000 Crore
